1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: I heard many like there: comforters of vexation ye all.

3.text: Was there an end to words of wind? or what will provoke thee that thou wilt answer?

4.text: Also I will speak as you: if it is your soul instead of my soul, I will join together with words against you, and shake my head against you upon it.

5.text: I will strengthen you with my month, the moving of my lips shall hold back.

6.text: If I shall speak, my pain will not be held back, and shall I cease, what will go from me?

7.text: But now he made me weary: thou hast made desolate all mine assembly.

8.text: Thou wilt lay fast hold on me to be for a testimony, and my leanness will rise up in me; it will answer against my face.

9.text: He rent in his anger, and he will lie in wait for me, gnashing upon me with his teeth; mine enemy will sharpen his eyes against me.

10.text: They gaped upon me with their mouth; with reproach they struck upon my cheek; they will fill out together against me.

11.text: God will shut me up to the evil one, and he will cast me into the hands of the unjust.

12.text: I was secure, and he will break me in pieces: and he seized upon my neck and he will disperse me, and he will set me up to him for a mark:

13.text: His multitudes will surround upon me, he will cleave my reins asunder, and not spare; he will pour my gall upon the earth.

14.text: He will break me, breaking upon the face of breaking; he will run upon me as the strong one.

15.text: I sewed together sackcloth upon my skin, and I thrust my horn into the dust.

16.text: My face became red from weeping, and upon my eye-lashes the shadow of death.

17.text: Not for violence in my hands: and my prayer is clean.

18.text: O earth, thou wilt not cover my blood; and shall there not be place for my cry?

19.text: Also now, behold, my witness in the heavens, and my testimony in the heights.

20.text: My friends mocking me: to God mine eye wept.

21.text: Shall he judge for a man with God? and the son of man for his neighbor?

22.text: When years of number shall come, and the way I shall go I shall not turn back.
